meanings.definition: Form a concept or idea of something
meanings.sent1: I tried to conceptualize the plot of the story in my mind.
meanings.sent2: Artists often conceptualize their ideas before putting them on canvas.
meanings.sent3: It was hard to conceptualize how a cat could drive a car in the cartoon.
meanings.sent4: She asked us to conceptualize the concept of time as a flowing river.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a diagram to help us conceptualize the solar system.

meanings.definition: To understand or interpret something in a conceptual way
meanings.sent1: I struggle to conceptualize the complex math problem in my head.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often conceptualize data to draw meaningful conclusions.
meanings.sent3: It's funny to conceptualize a dog wearing glasses and reading a book.
meanings.sent4: She asked us to conceptualize the idea of happiness as a warm blanket.
meanings.sent5: The artist used colors to help us conceptualize the feeling of joy.
